item.title: ‚ÄúShe walked everywhere. She put her party shoes in a bag and donned her trainers. She walked. Zara believed that a woman should be able to walk home‚Ä¶She was in the heart of her community, ten minutes from home. 'We all need to be talking about what happened to OUR ZARA‚Äù

item.title:
RT by @fatimamanji: New: Four days after the Grenfell fire a police assessment warned of 'crime and disorder' because of the 'Muslim background' of the victims.
Community lawyers say: "This is Islamophobia. It‚Äôs racism. It is the elephant staring back at us in the room"
https://www.insidehousing.co.uk/news/islamophobic-police-document-predicted-crime-and-disorder-after-grenfell-fire-due-to-muslim-background-of-victims-76262

item.title: Birds of prey are being illegally killed to maintain grouse and pheasant shooting in the UK. This time a sting operation involving hidden cameras by the @Natures_Voice caught dead birds being dumped. Report with @NanettevdLaan
item.dc:creator: @fatimamanji
item.description:
Birds of prey are being illegally killed to maintain grouse and pheasant shooting in the UK. This time a sting operation involving hidden cameras by the @Natures_Voice caught dead birds being dumped. Report with @NanettevdLaan

item.description: Watch the full interview with @fatimamanji here: channel4.com/news/dr-deborah‚Ä¶

item.title:
RT by @fatimamanji: "I was caught completely off guard."
Dr Deborah Birx was the White House coronavirus response co-ordinator whilst Donald Trump was president.
She tells @fatimamanji how she was "stunned" by his suggestion of injecting disinfectant as a treatment for Covid in 2020.
item.dc:creator: @Channel4News
item.description:
"I was caught completely off guard."

Dr Deborah Birx was the White House coronavirus response co-ordinator whilst Donald Trump was president.

She tells @fatimamanji how she was "stunned" by his suggestion of injecting disinfectant as a treatment for Covid in 2020.

item.title:
RT by @fatimamanji: "Every event is marked by the absence of Alaa for us."
British-Egyptian activist Alaa El-Fattah was sentenced for a post he made on Facebook and has spent most of the last decade in prison.
His cousin and sister talk to @fatimamanji about the impact of his imprisonment.
item.dc:creator: @Channel4News
item.description:
"Every event is marked by the absence of Alaa for us."

British-Egyptian activist Alaa El-Fattah was sentenced for a post he made on Facebook and has spent most of the last decade in prison.

His cousin and sister talk to @fatimamanji about the impact of his imprisonment.
